alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 9:05PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Arthur, western Cherry, Grant, northeastern Garden and southeastern Sheridan Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 804 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Merriman to 29 miles southeast of Gordon to 9 miles southwest of Ashby to 11 miles northeast of Oshkosh. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Arthur, Hyannis, Merriman, Medicine Lake, Whitman, Ashby, Eli, Duluth, Dipping Vat Meadow, Swede Lake, Irwin, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Bourquim Hill, Indian Hill, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Pratt Lake, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Haythorn Lake, Rackett and Morgan Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 119 and 152. Highway 2 between mile markers 127 and 160. Highway 61 between mile markers 115 and 231. Highway 92 between mile markers 165 and 166. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry
